title: Shark biologist Christine Dudgeon and the mystery of shark virgin birth

organizations.name: uq's school of biomedical sciences  listen

text:
Shark biologist Christine Dudgeon and the mystery of shark virgin birth Share MP3 available 12.95 MB 
Christine says all sharks, even the fearsome Great White, are undeserving of their killer reputation. 
Chris has spent her working life as a biologist diving on reefs, being submerged in shark cages, and in some cases grabbing sharks by their tail, to aid her studies of sharks of all kinds. 
In 2016 a bizarre event at a North Queensland aquarium put Chris's name in the media. 
It was discovered that a small, female leopard shark called Leonie had given birth to three pups, without any evidence of a male shark being involved. 
Chris's documenting of this case of shark parthenogenesis, or virgin birth, made global headlines. 
Further information 
Chris is a Postdoctoral Researcher in the Shark and Ray Laboratory, UQ's School of Biomedical Sciences 
Listen to Richard's conversation with marine biologist and underwater cameraman Richard Fitzpatrick Duration: 28min 17sec Broadcast: Tue 14 Feb 2017, 11:00am Published: Mon 13 Feb 2017, 6:30pm Guests
